022/** This class is for the ADIS16470 IMU that connects to the RoboRIO SPI port. */
023@SuppressWarnings("PMD.RedundantFieldInitializer")
024public class ADIS16470_IMU implements AutoCloseable, Sendable {
025  /* ADIS16470 Register Map Declaration */
026  private static final int FLASH_CNT = 0x00; // Flash memory write count
027  private static final int DIAG_STAT = 0x02; // Diagnostic and operational status
028  private static final int X_GYRO_LOW = 0x04; // X-axis gyroscope output, lower word
029  private static final int X_GYRO_OUT = 0x06; // X-axis gyroscope output, upper word
030  private static final int Y_GYRO_LOW = 0x08; // Y-axis gyroscope output, lower word
031  private static final int Y_GYRO_OUT = 0x0A; // Y-axis gyroscope output, upper word
032  private static final int Z_GYRO_LOW = 0x0C; // Z-axis gyroscope output, lower word
033  private static final int Z_GYRO_OUT = 0x0E; // Z-axis gyroscope output, upper word
034  private static final int X_ACCL_LOW = 0x10; // X-axis accelerometer output, lower word
035  private static final int X_ACCL_OUT = 0x12; // X-axis accelerometer output, upper word
036  private static final int Y_ACCL_LOW = 0x14; // Y-axis accelerometer output, lower word
037  private static final int Y_ACCL_OUT = 0x16; // Y-axis accelerometer output, upper word
038  private static final int Z_ACCL_LOW = 0x18; // Z-axis accelerometer output, lower word
039  private static final int Z_ACCL_OUT = 0x1A; // Z-axis accelerometer output, upper word
040  private static final int TEMP_OUT = 0x1C; // Temperature output (internal, not calibrated)
041  private static final int TIME_STAMP = 0x1E; // PPS mode time stamp
042  private static final int X_DELTANG_LOW = 0x24; // X-axis delta angle output, lower word
043  private static final int X_DELTANG_OUT = 0x26; // X-axis delta angle output, upper word
044  private static final int Y_DELTANG_LOW = 0x28; // Y-axis delta angle output, lower word
045  private static final int Y_DELTANG_OUT = 0x2A; // Y-axis delta angle output, upper word
046  private static final int Z_DELTANG_LOW = 0x2C; // Z-axis delta angle output, lower word
047  private static final int Z_DELTANG_OUT = 0x2E; // Z-axis delta angle output, upper word
048  private static final int X_DELTVEL_LOW = 0x30; // X-axis delta velocity output, lower word
049  private static final int X_DELTVEL_OUT = 0x32; // X-axis delta velocity output, upper word
050  private static final int Y_DELTVEL_LOW = 0x34; // Y-axis delta velocity output, lower word
051  private static final int Y_DELTVEL_OUT = 0x36; // Y-axis delta velocity output, upper word
052  private static final int Z_DELTVEL_LOW = 0x38; // Z-axis delta velocity output, lower word
053  private static final int Z_DELTVEL_OUT = 0x3A; // Z-axis delta velocity output, upper word
054  private static final int XG_BIAS_LOW =
055      0x40; // X-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, lower word
056  private static final int XG_BIAS_HIGH =
057      0x42; // X-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, upper word
058  private static final int YG_BIAS_LOW =
059      0x44; // Y-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, lower word
060  private static final int YG_BIAS_HIGH =
061      0x46; // Y-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, upper word
062  private static final int ZG_BIAS_LOW =
063      0x48; // Z-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, lower word
064  private static final int ZG_BIAS_HIGH =
065      0x4A; // Z-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, upper word
066  private static final int XA_BIAS_LOW =
067      0x4C; // X-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, lower word
068  private static final int XA_BIAS_HIGH =
069      0x4E; // X-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, upper word
070  private static final int YA_BIAS_LOW =
071      0x50; // Y-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, lower word
072  private static final int YA_BIAS_HIGH =
073      0x52; // Y-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, upper word
074  private static final int ZA_BIAS_LOW =
075      0x54; // Z-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, lower word
076  private static final int ZA_BIAS_HIGH =
077      0x56; // Z-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, upper word
078  private static final int FILT_CTRL = 0x5C; // Filter control
079  private static final int MSC_CTRL = 0x60; // Miscellaneous control
080  private static final int UP_SCALE = 0x62; // Clock scale factor, PPS mode
081  private static final int DEC_RATE = 0x64; // Decimation rate control (output data rate)
082  private static final int NULL_CNFG = 0x66; // Auto-null configuration control
083  private static final int GLOB_CMD = 0x68; // Global commands
084  private static final int FIRM_REV = 0x6C; // Firmware revision
085  private static final int FIRM_DM = 0x6E; // Firmware revision date, month and day
086  private static final int FIRM_Y = 0x70; // Firmware revision date, year
087  private static final int PROD_ID = 0x72; // Product identification
088  private static final int SERIAL_NUM = 0x74; // Serial number (relative to assembly lot)
089  private static final int USER_SCR1 = 0x76; // User scratch register 1
090  private static final int USER_SCR2 = 0x78; // User scratch register 2
091  private static final int USER_SCR3 = 0x7A; // User scratch register 3
092  private static final int FLSHCNT_LOW = 0x7C; // Flash update count, lower word
093  private static final int FLSHCNT_HIGH = 0x7E; // Flash update count, upper word
094
095  // Weight between the previous and current gyro angles represents 1 second for the timestamp,
096  // this is the point at which we ignore the previous angle because it is too old to be of use.
097  // The IMU timestamp conversion is 1 = 49.02us, the value 1_000_000 is the number of microseconds
098  // we average over.
099  private static final double AVERAGE_RATE_SCALING_FACTOR = 49.02 / 1_000_000;
100
101  private static final byte[] m_autospi_allAngle_packet = {
102    X_DELTANG_OUT,
103    FLASH_CNT,
104    X_DELTANG_LOW,
105    FLASH_CNT,
106    Y_DELTANG_OUT,
107    FLASH_CNT,
108    Y_DELTANG_LOW,
109    FLASH_CNT,
110    Z_DELTANG_OUT,
111    FLASH_CNT,
112    Z_DELTANG_LOW,
113    FLASH_CNT,
114    X_GYRO_OUT,
115    FLASH_CNT,
116    Y_GYRO_OUT,
117    FLASH_CNT,
118    Z_GYRO_OUT,
119    FLASH_CNT,
120    X_ACCL_OUT,
121    FLASH_CNT,
122    Y_ACCL_OUT,
123    FLASH_CNT,
124    Z_ACCL_OUT,
125    FLASH_CNT
126  };
127
128  /** ADIS16470 calibration times. */
129  public enum CalibrationTime {
130    /** 32 ms calibration time. */
131    _32ms(0),
132    /** 64 ms calibration time. */
133    _64ms(1),
134    /** 128 ms calibration time. */
135    _128ms(2),
136    /** 256 ms calibration time. */
137    _256ms(3),
138    /** 512 ms calibration time. */
139    _512ms(4),
140    /** 1 s calibration time. */
141    _1s(5),
142    /** 2 s calibration time. */
143    _2s(6),
144    /** 4 s calibration time. */
145    _4s(7),
146    /** 8 s calibration time. */
147    _8s(8),
148    /** 16 s calibration time. */
149    _16s(9),
150    /** 32 s calibration time. */
151    _32s(10),
152    /** 64 s calibration time. */
153    _64s(11);
154
155    private final int value;
156
157    CalibrationTime(int value) {
158      this.value = value;
159    }
160  }
161
162  /**
163   * IMU axes.
164   *
165   * <p>kX, kY, and kZ refer to the IMU's X, Y, and Z axes respectively. kYaw, kPitch, and kRoll are
166   * configured by the user to refer to an X, Y, or Z axis.
167   */
168  public enum IMUAxis {
169    /** The IMU's X axis. */
170    kX,
171    /** The IMU's Y axis. */
172    kY,
173    /** The IMU's Z axis. */
174    kZ,
175    /** The user-configured yaw axis. */
176    kYaw,
177    /** The user-configured pitch axis. */
178    kPitch,
179    /** The user-configured roll axis. */
180    kRoll,
181  }
182
183  // Static Constants
184  private static final double kDeltaAngleSf = 2160.0 / 2147483648.0; // 2160 / (2^31)
185  private static final double kGrav = 9.81;
186
187  // User-specified axes
188  private IMUAxis m_yaw_axis;
189  private IMUAxis m_pitch_axis;
190  private IMUAxis m_roll_axis;
191
192  // Instant raw outputs
193  private double m_gyro_rate_x = 0.0;
194  private double m_gyro_rate_y = 0.0;
195  private double m_gyro_rate_z = 0.0;
196  private double m_accel_x = 0.0;
197  private double m_accel_y = 0.0;
198  private double m_accel_z = 0.0;
199
200  // Integrated gyro angle
201  private double m_integ_angle_x = 0.0;
202  private double m_integ_angle_y = 0.0;
203  private double m_integ_angle_z = 0.0;
204
205  // Complementary filter variables
206  private double m_dt = 0.0;
207  private double m_alpha = 0.0;
208  private static final double kTau = 1.0;
209  private double m_compAngleX = 0.0;
210  private double m_compAngleY = 0.0;
211  private double m_accelAngleX = 0.0;
212  private double m_accelAngleY = 0.0;
213
214  // State variables
215  private volatile boolean m_thread_active = false;
216  private int m_calibration_time = 0;
217  private volatile boolean m_first_run = true;
218  private volatile boolean m_thread_idle = false;
219  private boolean m_auto_configured = false;
220  private double m_scaled_sample_rate = 2500.0;
221
222  // Resources
223  private SPI m_spi;
224  private SPI.Port m_spi_port;
225  private DigitalInput m_auto_interrupt;
226  private DigitalInput m_reset_in;
227  private DigitalOutput m_status_led;
228  private Thread m_acquire_task;
229  private boolean m_connected;
230
231  private SimDevice m_simDevice;
232  private SimBoolean m_simConnected;
233  private SimDouble m_simGyroAngleX;
234  private SimDouble m_simGyroAngleY;
235  private SimDouble m_simGyroAngleZ;
236  private SimDouble m_simGyroRateX;
237  private SimDouble m_simGyroRateY;
238  private SimDouble m_simGyroRateZ;
239  private SimDouble m_simAccelX;
240  private SimDouble m_simAccelY;
241  private SimDouble m_simAccelZ;
242
243  /**
244   * Creates a new ADIS16740 IMU object.
245   *
246   * <p>The default setup is the onboard SPI port with a calibration time of 1 second. Yaw, pitch,
247   * and roll are kZ, kX, and kY respectively.
248   */
249  public ADIS16470_IMU() {
250    this(IMUAxis.kZ, IMUAxis.kX, IMUAxis.kY, SPI.Port.kOnboardCS0, CalibrationTime._1s);
251  }
252
253  /**
254   * Creates a new ADIS16740 IMU object.
255   *
256   * <p>The default setup is the onboard SPI port with a calibration time of 1 second.
257   *
258   * <p><b><i>Input axes limited to kX, kY and kZ. Specifying kYaw, kPitch,or kRoll will result in
259   * an error.</i></b>
260   *
261   * @param yaw_axis The axis that measures the yaw
262   * @param pitch_axis The axis that measures the pitch
263   * @param roll_axis The axis that measures the roll
264   */
265  public ADIS16470_IMU(IMUAxis yaw_axis, IMUAxis pitch_axis, IMUAxis roll_axis) {
266    this(yaw_axis, pitch_axis, roll_axis, SPI.Port.kOnboardCS0, CalibrationTime._1s);
267  }
268
269  /**
270   * Creates a new ADIS16740 IMU object.
271   *
272   * <p><b><i>Input axes limited to kX, kY and kZ. Specifying kYaw, kPitch,or kRoll will result in
273   * an error.</i></b>
274   *
275   * @param yaw_axis The axis that measures the yaw
276   * @param pitch_axis The axis that measures the pitch
277   * @param roll_axis The axis that measures the roll
278   * @param port The SPI Port the gyro is plugged into
279   * @param cal_time Calibration time
280   */
281  @SuppressWarnings("this-escape")
282  public ADIS16470_IMU(
283      IMUAxis yaw_axis,
284      IMUAxis pitch_axis,
285      IMUAxis roll_axis,
286      SPI.Port port,
287      CalibrationTime cal_time) {
288    if (yaw_axis == IMUAxis.kYaw
289        || yaw_axis == IMUAxis.kPitch
290        || yaw_axis == IMUAxis.kRoll
291        || pitch_axis == IMUAxis.kYaw
292        || pitch_axis == IMUAxis.kPitch
293        || pitch_axis == IMUAxis.kRoll
294        || roll_axis == IMUAxis.kYaw
295        || roll_axis == IMUAxis.kPitch
296        || roll_axis == IMUAxis.kRoll) {
297      DriverStation.reportError(
298          "ADIS16470 constructor only allows IMUAxis.kX, IMUAxis.kY or IMUAxis.kZ as arguments.",
299          false);
300      DriverStation.reportError(
301          "Constructing ADIS with default axes. (IMUAxis.kZ is defined as Yaw)", false);
302      yaw_axis = IMUAxis.kZ;
303      pitch_axis = IMUAxis.kY;
304      roll_axis = IMUAxis.kX;
305    }
306
307    m_yaw_axis = yaw_axis;
308    m_pitch_axis = pitch_axis;
309    m_roll_axis = roll_axis;
310
311    m_calibration_time = cal_time.value;
312    m_spi_port = port;
313
314    m_acquire_task = new Thread(this::acquire);
315
316    m_simDevice = SimDevice.create("Gyro:ADIS16470", port.value);
317    if (m_simDevice != null) {
318      m_simConnected = m_simDevice.createBoolean("connected", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, true);
319      m_simGyroAngleX = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_angle_x", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
320      m_simGyroAngleY = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_angle_y", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
321      m_simGyroAngleZ = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_angle_z", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
322      m_simGyroRateX = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_rate_x", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
323      m_simGyroRateY = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_rate_y", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
324      m_simGyroRateZ = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_rate_z", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
325      m_simAccelX = m_simDevice.createDouble("accel_x", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
326      m_simAccelY = m_simDevice.createDouble("accel_y", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
327      m_simAccelZ = m_simDevice.createDouble("accel_z", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
328    }
329
330    if (m_simDevice == null) {
331      // Force the IMU reset pin to toggle on startup (doesn't require DS enable)
332      // Relies on the RIO hardware by default configuring an output as low
333      // and configuring an input as high Z. The 10k pull-up resistor internal to the
334      // IMU then forces the reset line high for normal operation.
335      var reset_out = new DigitalOutput(27); // Drive SPI CS2 (IMU RST) low
336      Timer.delay(0.01);
337      reset_out.close();
338      m_reset_in = new DigitalInput(27); // Set SPI CS2 (IMU RST) high
339      Timer.delay(0.25); // Wait for reset to complete
340
341      if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
342        return;
343      }
344      boolean needsFlash = false;
345      // Set IMU internal decimation to 4 (ODR = 2000 SPS / (4 + 1) = 400Hz), BW = 200Hz
346      if (readRegister(DEC_RATE) != 0x0004) {
347        writeRegister(DEC_RATE, 0x0004);
348        needsFlash = true;
349        DriverStation.reportWarning(
350            "ADIS16470: DEC_RATE register configuration inconsistent! Scheduling flash update.",
351            false);
352      }
353
354      // Set data ready polarity (HIGH = Good Data), Disable gSense Compensation and PoP
355      if (readRegister(MSC_CTRL) != 0x0001) {
356        writeRegister(MSC_CTRL, 0x0001);
357        needsFlash = true;
358        DriverStation.reportWarning(
359            "ADIS16470: MSC_CTRL register configuration inconsistent! Scheduling flash update.",
360            false);
361      }
362
363      // Disable IMU internal Bartlett filter (200Hz bandwidth is sufficient)
364      if (readRegister(FILT_CTRL) != 0x0000) {
365        writeRegister(FILT_CTRL, 0x0000);
366        needsFlash = true;
367        DriverStation.reportWarning(
368            "ADIS16470: FILT_CTRL register configuration inconsistent! Scheduling flash update.",
369            false);
370      }
371
372      // If any registers on the IMU don't match the config, trigger a flash update
373      if (needsFlash) {
374        DriverStation.reportWarning(
375            "ADIS16470: Register configuration changed! Starting IMU flash update.", false);
376        writeRegister(GLOB_CMD, 0x0008);
377        // Wait long enough for the flash update to finish (72ms minimum as per the datasheet)
378        Timer.delay(0.3);
379        DriverStation.reportWarning("ADIS16470: Flash update finished!", false);
380      } else {
381        DriverStation.reportWarning(
382            "ADIS16470: Flash and RAM configuration consistent. No flash update required!", false);
383      }
384
385      // Configure continuous bias calibration time based on user setting
386      writeRegister(NULL_CNFG, m_calibration_time | 0x0700);
387
388      // Notify DS that IMU calibration delay is active
389      DriverStation.reportWarning("ADIS16470: Starting initial calibration delay.", false);
390
391      // Wait for samples to accumulate internal to the IMU (110% of user-defined
392      // time)
393      try {
394        Thread.sleep((long) (Math.pow(2.0, m_calibration_time) / 2000 * 64 * 1.1 * 1000));
395      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
396      }
397
398      // Write offset calibration command to IMU
399      writeRegister(GLOB_CMD, 0x0001);
400
401      if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
402        return;
403      }
404
405      // Let the user know the IMU was initialized successfully
406      DriverStation.reportWarning("ADIS16470 IMU Successfully Initialized!", false);
407
408      // Drive "Ready" LED low
409      m_status_led = new DigitalOutput(28); // Set SPI CS3 (IMU Ready LED) low
410    }
411
412    // Report usage and post data to DS
413    HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_ADIS16470, 0);
414    m_connected = true;
415  }
416
417  /**
418   * Checks the connection status of the IMU.
419   *
420   * @return True if the IMU is connected, false otherwise.
421   */
422  public boolean isConnected() {
423    if (m_simConnected != null) {
424      return m_simConnected.get();
425    }
426    return m_connected;
427  }
428
429  private static int toShort(int upper, int lower) {
430    return (short) (((upper & 0xFF) << 8) + (lower & 0xFF));
431  }
432
433  private static int toInt(int msb, int byte2, int byte3, int lsb) {
434    return (msb & 0xFF) << 24 | (byte2 & 0xFF) << 16 | (byte3 & 0xFF) << 8 | (lsb & 0xFF);
435  }
436
437  /**
438   * Switch to standard SPI mode.
439   *
440   * @return True if successful, false otherwise.
441   */
442  private boolean switchToStandardSPI() {
443    // Check to see whether the acquire thread is active. If so, wait for it to stop
444    // producing data.
445    if (m_thread_active) {
446      m_thread_active = false;
447      while (!m_thread_idle) {
448        try {
449          Thread.sleep(10);
450        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
451        }
452      }
453      System.out.println("Paused the IMU processing thread successfully!");
454      // Maybe we're in auto SPI mode? If so, kill auto SPI, and then SPI.
455      if (m_spi != null && m_auto_configured) {
456        m_spi.stopAuto();
457        // We need to get rid of all the garbage left in the auto SPI buffer after
458        // stopping it.
459        // Sometimes data magically reappears, so we have to check the buffer size a
460        // couple of times to be sure we got it all. Yuck.
461        int[] trashBuffer = new int[200];
462        try {
463          Thread.sleep(100);
464        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
465        }
466        int data_count = m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(trashBuffer, 0, 0);
467        while (data_count > 0) {
468          m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(trashBuffer, Math.min(data_count, 200), 0);
469          data_count = m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(trashBuffer, 0, 0);
470        }
471        System.out.println("Paused auto SPI successfully.");
472      }
473    }
474    if (m_spi == null) {
475      m_spi = new SPI(m_spi_port);
476      m_spi.setClockRate(2000000);
477      m_spi.setMode(SPI.Mode.kMode3);
478      m_spi.setChipSelectActiveLow();
479    }
480    readRegister(PROD_ID); // Dummy read
481    // Validate the product ID
482    if (readRegister(PROD_ID) != 16982) {
483      DriverStation.reportError("Could not find an ADIS16470", false);
484      close();
485      return false;
486    }
487    return true;
488  }
489
490  /**
491   * Switch to auto SPI mode.
492   *
493   * @return True if successful, false otherwise.
494   */
495  boolean switchToAutoSPI() {
496    // No SPI port has been set up. Go set one up first.
497    if (m_spi == null && !switchToStandardSPI()) {
498      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to start/restart auto SPI", false);
499      return false;
500    }
501    // Only set up the interrupt if needed.
502    if (m_auto_interrupt == null) {
503      // Configure interrupt on SPI CS1
504      m_auto_interrupt = new DigitalInput(26);
505    }
506    // The auto SPI controller gets angry if you try to set up two instances on one
507    // bus.
508    if (!m_auto_configured) {
509      m_spi.initAuto(8200);
510      m_auto_configured = true;
511    }
512    // Do we need to change auto SPI settings?
513    m_spi.setAutoTransmitData(m_autospi_allAngle_packet, 2);
514    // Configure auto stall time
515    m_spi.configureAutoStall(5, 1000, 1);
516    // Kick off auto SPI (Note: Device configuration impossible after auto SPI is
517    // activated)
518    // DR High = Data good (data capture should be triggered on the rising edge)
519    m_spi.startAutoTrigger(m_auto_interrupt, true, false);
520    // Check to see if the acquire thread is running. If not, kick one off.
521    if (!m_acquire_task.isAlive()) {
522      m_first_run = true;
523      m_thread_active = true;
524      m_acquire_task.start();
525      System.out.println("Processing thread activated!");
526    } else {
527      // The thread was running, re-init run variables and start it up again.
528      m_first_run = true;
529      m_thread_active = true;
530      System.out.println("Processing thread activated!");
531    }
532    // Looks like the thread didn't start for some reason. Abort.
533    if (!m_acquire_task.isAlive()) {
534      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to start/restart the acquire() thread.", false);
535      close();
536      return false;
537    }
538    return true;
539  }
540
541  /**
542   * Configures calibration time.
543   *
544   * @param new_cal_time New calibration time
545   * @return 0 if success, 1 if no change, 2 if error.
546   */
547  public int configCalTime(CalibrationTime new_cal_time) {
548    if (m_calibration_time == new_cal_time.value) {
549      return 1;
550    }
551    if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
552      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure standard SPI.", false);
553      return 2;
554    }
555    m_calibration_time = new_cal_time.value;
556    writeRegister(NULL_CNFG, m_calibration_time | 0x700);
557    if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
558      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure auto SPI.", false);
559      return 2;
560    }
561    return 0;
562  }
563
564  /**
565   * Configures the decimation rate of the IMU.
566   *
567   * @param decimationRate The new decimation value.
568   * @return 0 if success, 1 if no change, 2 if error.
569   */
570  public int configDecRate(int decimationRate) {
571    // Switches the active SPI port to standard SPI mode, writes a new value to the DECIMATE
572    // register in the IMU, adjusts the sample scale factor, and re-enables auto SPI.
573    if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
574      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure standard SPI.", false);
575      return 2;
576    }
577    if (decimationRate > 1999) {
578      DriverStation.reportError("Attempted to write an invalid decimation value.", false);
579      decimationRate = 1999;
580    }
581    m_scaled_sample_rate = (decimationRate + 1.0) / 2000.0 * 1000000.0;
582    writeRegister(DEC_RATE, decimationRate);
583    System.out.println("Decimation register: " + readRegister(DEC_RATE));
584    if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
585      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure auto SPI.", false);
586      return 2;
587    }
588    return 0;
589  }
590
591  /**
592   * Calibrate the gyro. It's important to make sure that the robot is not moving while the
593   * calibration is in progress, this is typically done when the robot is first turned on while it's
594   * sitting at rest before the match starts.
595   */
596  public void calibrate() {
597    if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
598      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure standard SPI.", false);
599    }
600    writeRegister(GLOB_CMD, 0x0001);
601    if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
602      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure auto SPI.", false);
603    }
604  }
605
606  private int readRegister(int reg) {
607    final byte[] buf = {(byte) (reg & 0x7f), 0};
608
609    m_spi.write(buf, 2);
610    m_spi.read(false, buf, 2);
611
612    return (buf[0] << 8) & buf[1];
613  }
614
615  private void writeRegister(int reg, int val) {
616    // low byte
617    final byte[] buf = {(byte) (0x80 | reg), (byte) (val & 0xff)};
618    m_spi.write(buf, 2);
619    // high byte
620    buf[0] = (byte) (0x81 | reg);
621    buf[1] = (byte) (val >> 8);
622    m_spi.write(buf, 2);
623  }
624
625  /** Delete (free) the spi port used for the IMU. */
626  @Override
627  public void close() {
628    if (m_thread_active) {
629      m_thread_active = false;
630      try {
631        if (m_acquire_task != null) {
632          m_acquire_task.join();
633          m_acquire_task = null;
634        }
635      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
636      }
637      if (m_spi != null) {
638        if (m_auto_configured) {
639          m_spi.stopAuto();
640        }
641        m_spi.close();
642        m_auto_configured = false;
643        if (m_auto_interrupt != null) {
644          m_auto_interrupt.close();
645          m_auto_interrupt = null;
646        }
647        m_spi = null;
648      }
649    }
650    if (m_simDevice != null) {
651      m_simDevice.close();
652      m_simDevice = null;
653    }
654    System.out.println("Finished cleaning up after the IMU driver.");
655  }
656
657  private void acquire() {
658    // Set data packet length
659    final int dataset_len = 27; // 26 data points + timestamp
660    final int BUFFER_SIZE = 4000;
661
662    // Set up buffers and variables
663    int[] buffer = new int[BUFFER_SIZE];
664    double previous_timestamp = 0.0;
665    double compAngleX = 0.0;
666    double compAngleY = 0.0;
667    while (true) {
668      // Wait for data
669      try {
670        Thread.sleep(10);
671      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
672      }
673
674      if (m_thread_active) {
675        m_thread_idle = false;
676
677        // Read number of bytes currently stored in the buffer
678        int data_count = m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(buffer, 0, 0);
679        // Check if frame is incomplete
680        int data_remainder = data_count % dataset_len;
681        // Remove incomplete data from read count
682        int data_to_read = data_count - data_remainder;
683        // Want to cap the data to read in a single read at the buffer size
684        if (data_to_read > BUFFER_SIZE) {
685          DriverStation.reportWarning(
686              "ADIS16470 data processing thread overrun has occurred!", false);
687          data_to_read = BUFFER_SIZE - (BUFFER_SIZE % dataset_len);
688        }
689        // Read data from DMA buffer (only complete sets)
690        m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(buffer, data_to_read, 0);
691
692        // Could be multiple data sets in the buffer. Handle each one.
693        for (int i = 0; i < data_to_read; i += dataset_len) {
694          // Timestamp is at buffer[i]
695          m_dt = (buffer[i] - previous_timestamp) / 1000000.0;
696          // Get delta angle value for all 3 axes and scale by the elapsed time
697          // (based on timestamp)
698          double elapsed_time = m_scaled_sample_rate / (buffer[i] - previous_timestamp);
699          double delta_angle_x =
700              toInt(buffer[i + 3], buffer[i + 4], buffer[i + 5], buffer[i + 6])
701                  * kDeltaAngleSf
702                  / elapsed_time;
703          double delta_angle_y =
704              toInt(buffer[i + 7], buffer[i + 8], buffer[i + 9], buffer[i + 10])
705                  * kDeltaAngleSf
706                  / elapsed_time;
707          double delta_angle_z =
708              toInt(buffer[i + 11], buffer[i + 12], buffer[i + 13], buffer[i + 14])
709                  * kDeltaAngleSf
710                  / elapsed_time;
711
712          double gyro_rate_x = toShort(buffer[i + 15], buffer[i + 16]) / 10.0;
713          double gyro_rate_y = toShort(buffer[i + 17], buffer[i + 18]) / 10.0;
714          double gyro_rate_z = toShort(buffer[i + 19], buffer[i + 20]) / 10.0;
715
716          double accel_x = toShort(buffer[i + 21], buffer[i + 22]) / 800.0;
717          double accel_y = toShort(buffer[i + 23], buffer[i + 24]) / 800.0;
718          double accel_z = toShort(buffer[i + 25], buffer[i + 26]) / 800.0;
719
720          // Convert scaled sensor data to SI units (for tilt calculations)
721          // TODO: Should the unit outputs be selectable?
722          double gyro_rate_x_si = Math.toRadians(gyro_rate_x);
723          double gyro_rate_y_si = Math.toRadians(gyro_rate_y);
724          // double gyro_rate_z_si = Math.toRadians(gyro_rate_z);
725          double accel_x_si = accel_x * kGrav;
726          double accel_y_si = accel_y * kGrav;
727          double accel_z_si = accel_z * kGrav;
728
729          // Store timestamp for next iteration
730          previous_timestamp = buffer[i];
731
732          m_alpha = kTau / (kTau + m_dt);
733
734          // Run inclinometer calculations
735          double accelAngleX = Math.atan2(accel_x_si, Math.hypot(accel_y_si, accel_z_si));
736          double accelAngleY = Math.atan2(accel_y_si, Math.hypot(accel_x_si, accel_z_si));
737          if (m_first_run) {
738            compAngleX = accelAngleX;
739            compAngleY = accelAngleY;
740          } else {
741            accelAngleX = formatAccelRange(accelAngleX, accel_z_si);
742            accelAngleY = formatAccelRange(accelAngleY, accel_z_si);
743            compAngleX = compFilterProcess(compAngleX, accelAngleX, -gyro_rate_y_si);
744            compAngleY = compFilterProcess(compAngleY, accelAngleY, gyro_rate_x_si);
745          }
746
747          synchronized (this) {
748            // Push data to global variables
749            if (m_first_run) {
750              // Don't accumulate first run. previous_timestamp will be "very" old and the
751              // integration will end up way off
752              reset();
753            } else {
754              m_integ_angle_x += delta_angle_x;
755              m_integ_angle_y += delta_angle_y;
756              m_integ_angle_z += delta_angle_z;
757            }
758            m_gyro_rate_x = gyro_rate_x;
759            m_gyro_rate_y = gyro_rate_y;
760            m_gyro_rate_z = gyro_rate_z;
761            m_accel_x = accel_x;
762            m_accel_y = accel_y;
763            m_accel_z = accel_z;
764            m_compAngleX = Math.toDegrees(compAngleX);
765            m_compAngleY = Math.toDegrees(compAngleY);
766            m_accelAngleX = Math.toDegrees(accelAngleX);
767            m_accelAngleY = Math.toDegrees(accelAngleY);
768          }
769          m_first_run = false;
770        }
771      } else {
772        m_thread_idle = true;
773        previous_timestamp = 0.0;
774        compAngleX = 0.0;
775        compAngleY = 0.0;
776      }
777    }
778  }
779
780  private double formatFastConverge(double compAngle, double accAngle) {
781    if (compAngle > accAngle + Math.PI) {
782      compAngle = compAngle - 2.0 * Math.PI;
783    } else if (accAngle > compAngle + Math.PI) {
784      compAngle = compAngle + 2.0 * Math.PI;
785    }
786    return compAngle;
787  }
788
789  private double formatAccelRange(double accelAngle, double accelZ) {
790    if (accelZ < 0.0) {
791      accelAngle = Math.PI - accelAngle;
792    } else if (accelZ > 0.0 && accelAngle < 0.0) {
793      accelAngle = 2.0 * Math.PI + accelAngle;
794    }
795    return accelAngle;
796  }
797
798  private double compFilterProcess(double compAngle, double accelAngle, double omega) {
799    compAngle = formatFastConverge(compAngle, accelAngle);
800    compAngle = m_alpha * (compAngle + omega * m_dt) + (1.0 - m_alpha) * accelAngle;
801    return MathUtil.angleModulus(compAngle);
802  }
803
804  /**
805   * Reset the gyro.
806   *
807   * <p>Resets the gyro accumulations to a heading of zero. This can be used if there is significant
808   * drift in the gyro and it needs to be recalibrated after running.
809   */
810  public void reset() {
811    synchronized (this) {
812      m_integ_angle_x = 0.0;
813      m_integ_angle_y = 0.0;
814      m_integ_angle_z = 0.0;
815    }
816  }
817
818  /**
819   * Allow the designated gyro angle to be set to a given value. This may happen with unread values
820   * in the buffer, it is suggested that the IMU is not moving when this method is run.
821   *
822   * @param axis IMUAxis that will be changed
823   * @param angle A double in degrees (CCW positive)
824   */
825  public void setGyroAngle(IMUAxis axis, double angle) {
826    axis =
827        switch (axis) {
828          case kYaw -> m_yaw_axis;
829          case kPitch -> m_pitch_axis;
830          case kRoll -> m_roll_axis;
831          default -> axis;
832        };
833
834    switch (axis) {
835      case kX -> setGyroAngleX(angle);
836      case kY -> setGyroAngleY(angle);
837      case kZ -> setGyroAngleZ(angle);
838      default -> {
839        // NOP
840      }
841    }
842  }
843
844  /**
845   * Allow the gyro angle X to be set to a given value. This may happen with unread values in the
846   * buffer, it is suggested that the IMU is not moving when this method is run.
847   *
848   * @param angle A double in degrees (CCW positive)
849   */
850  public void setGyroAngleX(double angle) {
851    synchronized (this) {
852      m_integ_angle_x = angle;
853    }
854  }
855
856  /**
857   * Allow the gyro angle Y to be set to a given value. This may happen with unread values in the
858   * buffer, it is suggested that the IMU is not moving when this method is run.
859   *
860   * @param angle A double in degrees (CCW positive)
861   */
862  public void setGyroAngleY(double angle) {
863    synchronized (this) {
864      m_integ_angle_y = angle;
865    }
866  }
867
868  /**
869   * Allow the gyro angle Z to be set to a given value. This may happen with unread values in the
870   * buffer, it is suggested that the IMU is not moving when this method is run.
871   *
872   * @param angle A double in degrees (CCW positive)
873   */
874  public void setGyroAngleZ(double angle) {
875    synchronized (this) {
876      m_integ_angle_z = angle;
877    }
878  }
879
880  /**
881   * Returns the axis angle in degrees (CCW positive).
882   *
883   * @param axis The IMUAxis whose angle to return.
884   * @return The axis angle in degrees (CCW positive).
885   */
886  public synchronized double getAngle(IMUAxis axis) {
887    axis =
888        switch (axis) {
889          case kYaw -> m_yaw_axis;
890          case kPitch -> m_pitch_axis;
891          case kRoll -> m_roll_axis;
892          default -> axis;
893        };
894
895    return switch (axis) {
896      case kX -> {
897        if (m_simGyroAngleX != null) {
898          yield m_simGyroAngleX.get();
899        }
900        yield m_integ_angle_x;
901      }
902      case kY -> {
903        if (m_simGyroAngleY != null) {
904          yield m_simGyroAngleY.get();
905        }
906        yield m_integ_angle_y;
907      }
908      case kZ -> {
909        if (m_simGyroAngleZ != null) {
910          yield m_simGyroAngleZ.get();
911        }
912        yield m_integ_angle_z;
913      }
914      default -> 0.0;
915    };
916  }
917
918  /**
919   * Returns the Yaw axis angle in degrees (CCW positive).
920   *
921   * @return The Yaw axis angle in degrees (CCW positive).
922   */
923  public synchronized double getAngle() {
924    return getAngle(m_yaw_axis);
925  }
926
927  /**
928   * Returns the axis angular rate in degrees per second (CCW positive).
929   *
930   * @param axis The IMUAxis whose rate to return.
931   * @return Axis angular rate in degrees per second (CCW positive).
932   */
933  public synchronized double getRate(IMUAxis axis) {
934    axis =
935        switch (axis) {
936          case kYaw -> m_yaw_axis;
937          case kPitch -> m_pitch_axis;
938          case kRoll -> m_roll_axis;
939          default -> axis;
940        };
941
942    return switch (axis) {
943      case kX -> {
944        if (m_simGyroRateX != null) {
945          yield m_simGyroRateX.get();
946        }
947        yield m_gyro_rate_x;
948      }
949      case kY -> {
950        if (m_simGyroRateY != null) {
951          yield m_simGyroRateY.get();
952        }
953        yield m_gyro_rate_y;
954      }
955      case kZ -> {
956        if (m_simGyroRateZ != null) {
957          yield m_simGyroRateZ.get();
958        }
959        yield m_gyro_rate_z;
960      }
961      default -> 0.0;
962    };
963  }
964
965  /**
966   * Returns the Yaw axis angular rate in degrees per second (CCW positive).
967   *
968   * @return Yaw axis angular rate in degrees per second (CCW positive).
969   */
970  public synchronized double getRate() {
971    return getRate(m_yaw_axis);
972  }

975   * Returns which axis, kX, kY, or kZ, is set to the yaw axis.
976   *
977   * @return IMUAxis Yaw Axis
978   */
979  public IMUAxis getYawAxis() {
980    return m_yaw_axis;
981  }
982

984   * Returns which axis, kX, kY, or kZ, is set to the pitch axis.
985   *
986   * @return IMUAxis Pitch Axis
987   */
988  public IMUAxis getPitchAxis() {
989    return m_pitch_axis;
990  }
991
992  /**
993   * Returns which axis, kX, kY, or kZ, is set to the roll axis.
994   *
995   * @return IMUAxis Roll Axis
996   */
997  public IMUAxis getRollAxis() {
998    return m_roll_axis;
999  }

1001  /**
1002   * Returns the acceleration in the X axis in meters per second squared.
1003   *
1004   * @return The acceleration in the X axis in meters per second squared.
1005   */
1006  public synchronized double getAccelX() {
1007    return m_accel_x * kGrav;
1008  }
1009
1010  /**
1011   * Returns the acceleration in the Y axis in meters per second squared.
1012   *
1013   * @return The acceleration in the Y axis in meters per second squared.
1014   */
1015  public synchronized double getAccelY() {
1016    return m_accel_y * kGrav;
1017  }
1018
1019  /**
1020   * Returns the acceleration in the Z axis in meters per second squared.
1021   *
1022   * @return The acceleration in the Z axis in meters per second squared.
1023   */
1024  public synchronized double getAccelZ() {
1025    return m_accel_z * kGrav;
1026  }

1028  /**
1029   * Returns the complementary angle around the X axis computed from accelerometer and gyro rate
1030   * measurements.
1031   *
1032   * @return The X-axis complementary angle in degrees.
1033   */
1034  public synchronized double getXComplementaryAngle() {
1035    return m_compAngleX;
1036  }
1037
1038  /**
1039   * Returns the complementary angle around the Y axis computed from accelerometer and gyro rate
1040   * measurements.
1041   *
1042   * @return The Y-axis complementary angle in degrees.
1043   */
1044  public synchronized double getYComplementaryAngle() {
1045    return m_compAngleY;
1046  }

1048  /**
1049   * Returns the X-axis filtered acceleration angle in degrees.
1050   *
1051   * @return The X-axis filtered acceleration angle in degrees.
1052   */
1053  public synchronized double getXFilteredAccelAngle() {
1054    return m_accelAngleX;
1055  }
1056
1057  /**
1058   * Returns the Y-axis filtered acceleration angle in degrees.
1059   *
1060   * @return The Y-axis filtered acceleration angle in degrees.
1061   */
1062  public synchronized double getYFilteredAccelAngle() {
1063    return m_accelAngleY;
1064  }

1066  /**
1067   * Gets the SPI port number.
1068   *
1069   * @return The SPI port number.
1070   */
1071  public int getPort() {
1072    return m_spi_port.value;
1073  }
1074
1075  @Override
1076  public void initSendable(SendableBuilder builder) {
1077    builder.setSmartDashboardType("Gyro");
1078    builder.addDoubleProperty("Value", () -> getAngle(m_yaw_axis), null);
1079  }
1080}
